```
VAR
    refAirConditioning : REFERENCE TO FB_AirConditioning;
END_VAR

METHOD Execute
VAR
    refAirConditioning : REFERENCE TO FB_AirConditioning;
END_VAR

IF (__ISVALIDREF(THIS^.refAirConditioning)) THEN
    THIS^.refAirConditioning.Activate();
    THIS^.refAirConditioning.SetTemperature(22.0); // Set a comfortable temperature
END_IF
```

```iec
VAR
    refAirConditioning : REFERENCE TO FB_AirConditioning;
END_VAR
VAR_INPUT
    bInitRetains : BOOL; // if TRUE, the retain variables are initialized (warm start / cold start)
    bInCopyCode : BOOL;  // if TRUE, the instance afterwards gets moved into the copy code (online change)
    refNewAirConditioning : REFERENCE TO FB_AirConditioning;
END_VAR

// Initialization logic for the air conditioning reference
IF (__ISVALIDREF(refNewAirConditioning)) THEN
    THIS^.refAirConditioning REF= refNewAirConditioning;
ELSE
    THIS^.refAirConditioning REF= 0;
END_IF

// Additional logic for standby mode
IF (__ISVALIDREF(refAirConditioning)) THEN
    refAirConditioning.bActive := FALSE; // Set air conditioning to inactive
    refAirConditioning.lrTemperature := 25.0; // Set a default standby temperature
END_IF
```

```python
# Based on the provided code fragments, we can implement the functionality for the FB_AirConditioning function block
# and its associated methods. Below is a Python representation of the logic:

class AirConditioning:
    def __init__(self):
        self.bActive = False  # Boolean to indicate if the air conditioning is active
        self.lrTemperature = 0.0  # Current temperature of the air conditioning system

    def activate(self):
        """Activate the air conditioning system."""
        self.bActive = True
        print("Air conditioning activated.")

    def deactivate(self):
        """Deactivate the air conditioning system."""
        self.bActive = False
        print("Air conditioning deactivated.")

    def set_temperature(self, lrNewTemperature):
        """
        Set the temperature of the air conditioning system.
        
        Args:
            lrNewTemperature (float): The new temperature to set.
        """
        if self.bActive:
            self.lrTemperature = lrNewTemperature
            print(f"Temperature set to {lrNewTemperature}°C.")
            return True
        else:
            print("Cannot set temperature. Air conditioning is not active.")
            return False

# Example usage:
if __name__ == "__main__":
    air_conditioning = AirConditioning()

    # Activate the air conditioning
    air_conditioning.activate()

    # Set the temperature
    air_conditioning.set_temperature(22.5)

    # Deactivate the air conditioning
    air_conditioning.deactivate()
```

```
VAR
    refLamp : REFERENCE TO FB_Lamp; // Reference to the lamp object
    byNewLevel : BYTE;             // New brightness level to set
END_VAR

METHOD PUBLIC Execute : BOOL
VAR
    bSuccess : BOOL; // Indicates if the operation was successful
END_VAR

// Check if the lamp reference is valid
IF (__ISVALIDREF(refLamp)) THEN
    // Set the new brightness level for the lamp
    bSuccess := refLamp.SetLevel(byNewLevel);
    RETURN bSuccess; // Return the success status
ELSE
    // If the lamp reference is invalid, return FALSE
    RETURN FALSE;
END_IF
```

VAR
    refCDPlayer : REFERENCE TO FB_CDPlayer;
END_VAR

METHOD Execute
VAR
    refCDPlayer : REFERENCE TO FB_CDPlayer;
END_VAR

IF (__ISVALIDREF(THIS^.refCDPlayer)) THEN
    THIS^.refCDPlayer.Stop();
END_IF

# The FB_MusicStopCommand is responsible for stopping the music playback on the CD player.
# It checks if the reference to the CD player is valid before attempting to stop it.

# Additional functionality or methods can be added here if needed.
